column5: As long as you have a vaccination card for your chickens, you will be fine to cross!
Any word on egg or chicken ban this year with bird flu in both Minnesota and Wisconsin?

Last few trips to Ontario, we started to placed the egg yolk & white into freezer bags. Wasn't sure if this was OK with the border guards, but our thoughts were that the flu might be spread in the shells and that freezing the egg would kill the flu bug.
Eggs are fine as long as they originated in the US.https://inspection.canada.ca/food-sa.../1389630282362

I want to say that eggs coming from Indiana and another state were prohibited a few years ago. As I used to live in Chicago area, most of the eggs I saw in local grocery stores came from Indiana so I did not buy those. Eventually located eggs that came from Michigan. Not sure if the Canadian government still has a list of states to prohibit eggs from. I do all of the shopping for our group and have to say we have never been challenged or questioned about our groceries when entering Canada. The Canadian border guards always ask about live bait, booze, and guns. I always have our grocery receipts but haven't been asked to show them.
I just buy my eggs from Canada when I get there. No Worries.
I think the border has more to wry about than a frikin egg.
Yeah, like people smuggling in creepy crawlers !!!
Right!!!god forbid if a crawler got through,be dooms day.
